required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Follow up After Subtotal and Total Hysterectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Ultra Long-term Follow-up of the Outcome After Subtotal Versus Total Abdominal Hysterectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to find out subjective and objective outcomes of patients undergoing subtotal or total abdominal hysterectomy during a follow up of a mean 33 years after the operation. The hypothesis is that there are similar outcomes after both types of operations.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: To evaluate ultra long-term follow-up after subtotal and total hysterectomy in patients operated on during 1978-1979 in Turku University Hospital, Finland.
Methods: From the original cohort of 212 patients 193 were sent a postal questionnaire in 1997 to find out possible symptoms related to hysterectomy. Again in 2011 a questionnaire based evaluation with a possibility of a clinical visit to study hospital was done for 153 patients. In the first evaluation a self-made questionnaire and in the second evaluation validated questionnaires were used. During a follow-up visit a clinical examination using also POP-Q-system was done. Additionally, hospital records of the patients were reviewed to find out subsequent operations after hysterectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants having subjective symptoms after hysterectomy
primary_outcome.description: Urinary and bowel symptoms assessed with questionnaires and Visual Analog Scale. Sexual symptoms assessed with questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective evaluation of pelvic organ prolapse after hysterectomy
secondary_outcome.description: Gynecological examination and measurements using pelvic organ prolapse quantification system (POP-Q) to find out the number of participants having prolapse.

intervention.description: Comparison of women undergoing subtotal abdominal hysterectomy (n=107) and women with total abdominal hysterectomy (n=105) a mean of 33 years ago.

study_pop.textblock: The study population included 212 patients operated on during February 1978 and May 1979 in Turku University Hospital. 107 women underwent subtotal and 105 women total abdominal hysterectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- benign indication for hysterectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- abnormal Pap smear

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Turku University Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: Hysterectomy, long term follow up, subjective outcome
